header.comment: This configuration file was automatically created by GParserBuilder

maxResubmissions.comment: The amount of resubmissions allowed if a full return of work
items was expected but only a subset has returned

waitFactor.comment: A static double factor for timeouts
It is suggested to use values >= 1.

initialWaitFactor.comment: A static double factor for timeouts in the first iteration.
Set this to the inverse of the number of parallel processing

maxIteration.comment: The maximum allowed number of iterations

minIteration.comment: The minimum allowed number of iterations

maxStallIteration.comment: The maximum allowed number of iterations without improvement

terminationFile.comment: The name of a file which, when modified after the start of an
optimization run, instructs Geneva to terminate optimitation.
This can be used to "touch a file" after the start of an optimization
run, which will lead to the termination of the run after the current iteration.

indivdualUpdateStallCounterThreshold.comment: The number of iterations without improvement after which
individuals are asked to update their internal data structures
through the actOnStalls() function. A value of 0 disables this check

reportIteration.comment: The number of iterations after which a report should be issued

nRecordBestIndividuals.comment: Indicates how many "best" individuals should be recorded in each iteration

cpInterval.comment: The number of iterations after which a checkpoint should be written.
-1 means: Write a checkpoint file whenever an improvement was encountered

cpDirectory.comment: The directory where checkpoint files should be stored.

cpBaseName.comment: The significant part of the checkpoint file name.

cpOverwrite.comment: When set to "true", old checkpoint files will not be kept

cpSerMode.comment: Determines whether check-pointing should be done in

threshold.comment: A threshold beyond which optimization is expected to stop
Note that in order to activate this threshold, you also need to

thresholdActive.comment: Activates (1) or de-activates (0) the quality threshold

maxDuration.comment: The maximum allowed time-frame for the optimization

minDuration.comment: The minimum required time-frame for the optimization

emitTerminationReason.comment: Triggers emission (1) or omission (0) of information about reasons for termination

nNeighborhoods.comment: The desired number of neighborhoods in the population

nNeighborhoodMembers.comment: The desired number of members in each neighborhood

cPersonal.comment: A constant to be multiplied with the personal direction vector

cNeighborhood.comment: A constant to be multiplied with the neighborhood direction vector

cGlobal.comment: A constant to be multiplied with the global direction vector

cVelocity.comment: A constant to be multiplied with the old velocity vector

updateRule.comment: Specifies whether a linear (0) or classical (1)

randomFillUp.comment: Specifies whether neighborhoods should be filled up
randomly (true) or start with equal values (false)

repulsionThreshold.comment: The number of stalls as of which the algorithm switches to repulsive mode
Set this to 0 in order to disable this feature
